items.name: upload
items.title: Upload with Inertia.js
items.description: A complete file upload form example integrated with Laravel Inertia.js, showing form handling, validation, and submission.
items.docs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Remaining Installation Steps:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Install required Composer dependencies:
   composer require league/flysystem-aws-s3-v3:^3.0

2. Add the following routes to your routes/web.php file:
   Route::post('/upload', App\Http\Controllers\Astrify\UploadController::class)
       ->middleware(['auth'])
       ->name('upload.store');
   
   Route::post('/upload/signed-url', App\Http\Controllers\Astrify\SignedUrlController::class)
       ->middleware(['auth'])
       ->name('upload.signed-url');

3. Configure S3 storage by setting your AWS environment variables (MinIO recomended for local development).

**Note:** You may need to set up CORS for your S3 bucket to allow POST requests from your domain.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Usage:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

import { InertiaUpload } from '@/components/astrify/upload/upload';

<Upload 
  signedUrlEndpoint="/upload/signed-url"
  submitEndpoint="/documents"
  maxFiles={5}
  maxSize={10 * 1024 * 1024} // 10MB
/>
